alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 05 at 3:19AM MST until March 06 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY FROM NOON TO 6 PM MST ACROSS THE EASTERN PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong winds and low humidity are expected to redevelop this afternoon in the eastern plains of New Mexico. In addition, above average temperatures and an unstable atmosphere are expected to align over these areas where critical fire weather conditions will one again threaten. Windy conditions will return on Sunday, especially along and south of Interstate 40. Critical fire weather will be possible Sunday afternoon in portions of the Rio Grande valley and the east central plains of New Mexico where humidity will plummet again. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Portions of the Rio Grande valley in central New Mexico, especially within Socorro county for Sunday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Sustained west winds of 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Falling to 10 to 15 percent in the late afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch for Sunday.
